==Events==
*[[1066]] &ndash; [[1066 Granada massacre|Granada massacre]]: A [[Islam|Muslim]] mob storms the royal palace in [[Granada]], crucifies [[Jews|Jewish]] [[vizier]] Joseph ibn Naghrela and massacres most of the Jewish population of the city.
*[[1460]] &ndash; [[Wars of the Roses]]: [[Battle of Wakefield]].
*[[1702]] &ndash; [[Queen Anne's War]]: [[James Moore (South Carolina politician)|James Moore]], Governor of the [[Province of Carolina]], abandons the [[Siege of St. Augustine (1702)|Siege of St. Augustine]].
*[[1813]] &ndash; [[United Kingdom|British soldiers]] burn [[Buffalo, New York]] during the [[War of 1812]].
*[[1816]] &ndash; The [[Treaty of St. Louis#1816 - Ottawa, Ojibwa, and Potawatomi|Treaty of St. Louis (1816)]] between the [[United States]] and the united [[Odawa people|Ottawa]], [[Ojibwe people|Ojibwa]], and [[Potawatomi]] Indian tribes is proclaimed.
*[[1825]] &ndash; The [[Treaty of St. Louis#1825 - Shawnee|Treaty of St. Louis (1825)]] between the United States and the [[Shawnee]] Nation is proclaimed.
*[[1853]] &ndash; [[Gadsden Purchase]]: The United States buys land from [[Mexico]] to facilitate [[Rail transport|railroad]] building in the [[Southwestern United States|Southwest]].
*[[1896]] &ndash; Filipino patriot and reform advocate [[José Rizal]] is [[Capital punishment|executed]] by a Spanish [[Execution by firing squad|firing squad]] in [[Manila]], [[Philippines]].
*[[1896]] &ndash; Canadian [[ice hockey]] player [[Ernie McLea]] scores the first [[hat-trick]] in [[Stanley Cup]] play, and the Cup-winning goal as the [[Montreal Victorias]] defeat the [[Winnipeg Victorias]] 6–5.
*[[1897]] &ndash; The [[United Kingdom|British]] [[Colony of Natal]] annexes [[Zulu Kingdom|Zululand]].
*[[1903]] &ndash; [[Iroquois Theatre fire|A fire at the Iroquois Theater]] in [[Chicago|Chicago, Illinois]] kills at least 605.
*[[1905]] &ndash; Former [[Idaho]] Governor [[Frank Steunenberg]] is assassinated at the front gate of his home in [[Caldwell, Idaho|Caldwell]].
*[[1906]] &ndash; The [[All-India Muslim League]] is founded in [[Dhaka|Dacca]], [[East Bengal]], [[Presidencies and provinces of British India|British India]]. It went on to lay the foundations of [[Pakistan]].
*[[1916]] &ndash; The last [[coronation of the Hungarian monarch|coronation in Hungary]] is performed for King [[Charles I of Austria|Charles IV]] and Queen [[Zita of Bourbon-Parma|Zita]].
*[[1919]] &ndash; [[Lincoln's Inn]] in [[London]], [[England]], UK admits its first female bar student.
*[[1922]] &ndash; The [[Soviet Union|Union of Soviet Socialist Republics]] [[Treaty on the Creation of the USSR|is formed]].
*[[1927]] &ndash; The [[Tokyo Metro Ginza Line|Ginza Line]], the first [[rapid transit|subway line]] in [[Asia]], opens in [[Tokyo]], [[Japan]].
*[[1936]] &ndash; The [[United Auto Workers]] [[trade union|union]] stages its first [[sitdown strike]].
*[[1943]] &ndash; [[Subhas Chandra Bose]] raises the flag of [[India]]n independence at [[Port Blair]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; King [[George II of Greece]] declares a regency, leaving the throne vacant.
*[[1947]] &ndash; King [[Michael I of Romania]] is forced to abdicate by the Soviet Union-backed Communist government of [[Romania]].
*[[1948]] &ndash; The [[Cole Porter]] [[Broadway theatre|Broadway]] musical, ''[[Kiss Me, Kate]]'' (1,077 performances), opens at the New Century Theatre and becomes the first show to win the Best Musical [[Tony Award]].
*[[1958]] &ndash; The [[Guatemalan Air Force]] sinks several Mexican fishing boats alleged to have breached maritime borders, killing 3 and sparking [[Mexico-Guatemala conflict|international tension]].
*[[1965]] &ndash; [[Ferdinand Marcos]] becomes [[President of the Philippines|President]] of the [[Philippines]].
*[[1972]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: The United States halts heavy bombing of [[North Vietnam]].
*[[1977]] &ndash; For the second time, [[Ted Bundy]] escapes from his cell in [[Glenwood Springs, Colorado]].
*[[1981]] &ndash; In the 39th game of his third [[National Hockey League|NHL]] season, [[Wayne Gretzky]] scores five goals, giving him 50 on the year and setting a new NHL record previously held by [[Maurice Richard]] and [[Mike Bossy]], who earlier had each scored 50 goals in 50 games.
*[[1993]] &ndash; [[Israel]] and [[Holy See|Vatican City]] establish diplomatic relations.
*[[1996]] &ndash; In the [[India]]n state of [[Assam]], a passenger train is bombed by [[Bodo people|Bodo]] separatists, killing 26.
*  1996   &ndash; Proposed budget cuts by [[Benjamin Netanyahu]] spark protests from 250,000 workers who shut down services across [[Israel]].
*[[1997]] &ndash; In the worst incident in [[Algeria]]'s insurgency, the [[Wilaya of Relizane massacres of 30 December 1997|Wilaya of Relizane massacres]], 400 people from four villages are killed.
*[[2000]] &ndash; [[Rizal Day bombings]]: A series of bombs explode in various places in [[Metro Manila]], Philippines within a period of a few hours, killing 22 and injuring about a hundred.
*[[2004]] &ndash; A fire in the [[República Cromañón nightclub fire|República Cromagnon nightclub]] in [[Buenos Aires]], [[Argentina]] kills 194.
*[[2005]] &ndash; [[Tropical Storm Zeta]] forms in the open [[Atlantic Ocean]], tying the record for the latest [[tropical cyclone]] ever to form in the [[Atlantic Ocean|North Atlantic basin]].
*[[2006]] &ndash; [[Madrid–Barajas Airport]] is [[2006 Madrid-Barajas Airport bombing|bombed]].
*  2006   &ndash; The Indonesian passenger ferry {{MV|Senopati Nusantara}} sinks in a storm, resulting in at least 400 deaths.
*  2006   &ndash; Former [[President of Iraq]] [[Saddam Hussein]] [[Execution of Saddam Hussein|is executed]]. 
*[[2009]] &ndash; A segment of the [[Lanzhou–Zhengzhou–Changsha pipeline]] ruptures in [[Shaanxi]], [[China]], and approximately {{convert|150000|l|usgal|abbr=on}} of [[Diesel fuel|diesel oil]] [[Yellow River oil spill|flows down]] the [[Wei River]] before finally reaching the [[Yellow River]].
*  2009   &ndash; A suicide bomber [[Camp Chapman attack|kills]] nine people at [[Forward Operating Base Chapman]], a key facility of the [[Central Intelligence Agency]] in [[Afghanistan]].
*[[2011]] &ndash; Owing to a [[Samoa Time Zone|change of time zone]] the day is skipped in [[Samoa]] and [[Tokelau]].
*[[2013]] &ndash; More than 100 people are killed when anti-government forces [[December 2013 Kinshasa attacks|attack]] key buildings in [[Kinshasa]], [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]].
